instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2838: What is 820-2838? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> isl
threads.message: What should I except betwen pin 27-28 in this board? 20 ohm? Schematic is not clear and pin27-28 goes to <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>? In schematic I cannot see it well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> isl
threads.message:
27 / 28 = 20.02ohm

Yes <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>

Same 6259 setup apart from the AC in threshold divider and <SIGNAL>VCOMP_R</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>VNEG_R</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> isl
threads.message: Ok. 8.40V for ppbus is ok or should be 8.60V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> isl
threads.message: What is the issue with the board? These do not auto power on.
